scriptment.name: The first scene in which the player controls the main character.

part.name: wakeup
part.narration: 1997. In the soft, luminescent glow of rosy bedsheets reflecting the Lyon morning sun lies Jacques' daughter.
From the comfort of the downstairs commons room coffee table, the parents two yell to their children. As Asami cranks her amplifier, her daughter exerts her self to wake. Yuki mumbles.
part.line: No — that's integer math — we need floating points —

Huh!</line. Yuki stirs. She rubs her eyes and stretches and yawns. With guitar in rust, Asami continues to coerce her daughter further toward the world of the waking. Asami over the riff speaks: I'll wake her with a song! Jacques sighs. A song? Isn't that quite a bit of effort to wake just Yuki? It takes quite a bit of effort to raise three children. We have two children. And isn't she — aren't they — fantastic? Asami laughs. She sings: My perfect daughter, it's time to go to school~ So brush your teeth, and break your bread too~ It's getting late! Get dressed, you've got to get to school on time~ The clock dictates your world, stay on it and you'll stay in line~ You'll master every note and tongue when I get through~ I'm reminded of my purpose every time I see you~ I expect only the best from the seeds I have sown~ If you're far above and flawless, I will call you My Own~ Through the barrage of stimulation, Yuki's world-view clutters. She begins to visualize the unspoken connection between the concrete and abstract. Visions of numerical and programmatic constructs storm her mind. Yuki clasps her temples and thrashes about—To communicate to the Player her overstimulation, the Vision tooltips focus on the objects of the room to random stimuli a distance away from Yuki. The clatter of plates, the sounds of footsteps, etc. So wake up! Wake up! Wake up! Wake up! The song reaches its coda. The interference subsides. Yuki may leave her bedroom in peace. When the player leaves the bedroom, the camera trucks right to the commons room as Yuki enters the bathroom. The camera continues to move downstairs, and Yuki begins to talk to herself in the mirror in the distance.
